171721134.review:
This game is like a toxic relationship... I can't stop playing!
Here's why:
Loading screens are the real endgame. Seriously, I could write a novel in the time it takes to load into a lobby. (Shoutout to the guy who said 2/3 of his playtime is loading!)
GTA Online proves world peace is a myth. Between the griefers, the tryhards, and the flying bikes, it's basically a warzone out there.
Lester is... something else. Dude needs to chill.
The radio is fire, though. Better than any real-life station, hands down. Don't @ me.
Rockstar's been milking this cow for years... And you know what? I'll keep drinking that sweet, sweet milk.
10/10 would get banned again. (RIP to my 1000+ hour account).

Nobody reads my reviews anyway.
I’ll throw in a recipe for Chicken cutlets with mushrooms

Products
Chicken - 700 g
White bread - 50 g
Milk - 100 ml
Vegetable oil - 50 ml
Small champignons - 15 pcs.
Chicken egg - 1 pc.
Onions - 1 pc.
Garlic - 3 teeth.
Salt - to taste
Pepper - to taste


Rinse the meat, remove from the bone and cut into pieces.

Pass the prepared poultry meat through a meat grinder along with the internal fat.

Combine the minced meat with bread pre-soaked in milk. If there is no milk in the house, replace it with just water.
Add salt, ground pepper, mix thoroughly, mince again, adding peeled onion and garlic.

Pour the beaten egg into the minced meat and beat the mixture well.

Form cutlets from the prepared cutlet mass with wet hands, hiding a small whole champignon inside each one.

Fry chicken cutlets with mushrooms on both sides until golden brown.

Place the fried cutlets in a refractory dish and finish cooking in an oven preheated to 200 degrees for about 15 minutes.

Bon appetit!

170496195.review:
In short: purely awesome singleplayer positively ticking all the boxes, timeless game, very thoroughly made GTA. Great multiplayer, huge LOT of quality content, still updating after all those years. GTA Online updates are like full-time DLCs and game does NOT require you to pay a single cent more to play them.

Back in the days when Rockstar banned the most common third-party cheat for GTA Online, cheaters started giving GTA 5 bad reviews. This game did not deserve such toxic reviewing. Since then the third-party cheats started to be more complex.

Unfortunately this is a huge affliction for the game. From my experience (Central Europe) there is at least one cheater on 90% of all public sessions (servers). These cheaters are griefing, bullying, ruining the game on all fronts. Their thorough third-party cheats can shutdown your game just with a single command, which happened to me many times. Freshly, they allegedly can give on your account a permanent ban on GTA Online. Reporting these cheaters can be comfortly done via pause menu, but it feels like the justice may never come to them. Also it is hard to know who is the cheater - they may kill other players by your own nickname. You can play GTA Online alone or with your friends in private sessions but you may miss some content that appears only in public sessions.

PS: By the time I am writing this review, Rockstar recently launched new official Community Guidelines where they - among other things - emphasized reporting such bad behavior. From the new Guidelines, it seems that Rockstar Support may be more active in punishing cheaters and more helpful to the victims. Time will see, let's hope for the best.

Cheating is for cowards ♥

170408877.review:
Still one of the best franchises of all time, this is a game where you get guaranteed fun. Def check it out below my detailed review:

GTA V is a masterpiece in the gaming world. The open-world sandbox game offers endless opportunities for exploration, missions, and mayhem. The graphics are stunning, the gameplay is top-notch, and the storyline is engaging and immersive. Whether you're causing chaos in the streets or trying to complete the main storyline, there is something for everyone in GTA V.
The attention to detail in the game is truly impressive, with realistic environments, diverse characters, and a vast array of vehicles to choose from. The multiplayer aspect adds even more depth to the game, allowing you to team up with friends or compete against other players in a variety of game modes.
Overall, GTA V is a must-play for any fan of action-adventure games. With its blend of exciting gameplay, stunning visuals, and endless possibilities, it's easy to see why this game has become a staple in the gaming community. Highly recommend.

171709235.review:
The game is meh. I bought it for around 10$ and can see the appeal and I have played what it was worth on sale but it feels devoid of deep content. I admit that from time to time I did return to it but it feels shallow. No doubt there is a surface charm but there is nothing beyond the superficial here-no probing into why these systems occur, no wondering about how to improve things, no vision beyond cynical annihilation.

Far more important and perhaps illuminating for newer gamers is my terrible customer service experience with RockStar Games. It was abysmal. Now, I knew of the rumors of long working hours that it foisted on its workers (allegedly for Red Dead Redemption 2) but I cringed and bought this and another game from them and the subsequent experience seemed entirely consistent with the ethos suggestive of the rumors.

What is absolutely outrageous on the customer service side of things is that when I tried to update my email contact info for another RockStar game I purchased and played on Steam years ago, Red Dead Redemption 2, not only did they NOT contact me recently when I felt like revisitng the game but they actually removed the RDR2 game from my Steam account. Later, when I looked up the service ticket it said "Resolved",lol. That is what you are dealing with here. No customer service. No respect for supporters of their games. Indeed, what I experienced from RockStar is nothing short of utter contempt. Buyer beware. If you ever lose access to your account email, the resolution process is nonsensical. They have a byzantine resolution process in order to get gamers to and this is speculation here purchase multiple instances of the same game using different email accounts, which in my view is unethical since you already purchased the game once. If users need to or merely want to switch email accounts that should be of no concern to RockStar since they already purchased the game! The way they are operating shows no respect for customers. What this means is that you will never own the game, RockStar does. Just think about it. You pay for a game. You forget your email password to the account you used to and in my case years ago to originally login to their equally nonsensical account system (why are emails NOT needed in virtually every other game you buy? Control over you, that's why!) and then when you merely ask how to shift the game to a new email that is accessible, they delete the game from your Steam account. It is shady beyond belief and for all its worth I will never hesitate in warning off others from a developer that engages in such business practices.

171690709.review: rockstar loves to lock you out of your games that you purchased

171382943.review: In it's current state, this game is just not fun to play. Just loading into the game is a chore, if you even load. Once you're in a public lobby, you either die because the modders that R* will do nothing about have teleport you to them and kill you while they're in God mode or your game takes 10 minutes or longer to load into your businesses, again, IF you load. The game is a buggy mess. Sometimes, you can't enter your car because your character has frozen in place, or you're being shot at by invisible enemies. The ONLY reason this game is popular now is because of independent RP servers and that's it. That being said, the game is gorgeous, even after 11 years of being released. Los Santos is huge and the folks who made assets for the game clearly loved making it. Of course, it can be a much different experience in invite-only lobbies with friends, but that goes without saying for almost all multiplayer games that friends make it better. If you still want to play, all I'll say is, prepare to be frustrated.

172028430.review:
Everyone knows this game is a banger, so here's my grandma's recipe of filet américain.

Ingredients:
500g (about 1 lb) of fresh beef tenderloin or high-quality steak, finely minced
2 egg yolks
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
1 tablespoon ketchup
1 tablespoon mayonnaise
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon capers, finely chopped
1 small shallot, finely minced
1 clove garlic, finely minced
1 teaspoon paprika
1 teaspoon Tabasco sauce (or other hot sauce, to taste)
1 teaspoon lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Freshly chopped parsley (optional, for garnish)

Instructions:
Prepare the Meat: Ensure the beef is very fresh and of high quality. Use a sharp knife or meat grinder to finely mince the beef. It's essential to work quickly and keep the meat cold to maintain its freshness.

In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg yolks, Dijon mustard, ketchup, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, chopped capers, minced shallot, minced garlic, paprika, Tabasco sauce, and lemon juice. Mix thoroughly until the sauce is smooth and well blended.

Add the finely minced beef to the sauce mixture. Use a fork or your hands to gently combine the meat with the sauce, ensuring everything is evenly distributed. Be careful not to overwork the meat, as you want to maintain a delicate texture.

Taste the mixture and add salt, pepper, and additional seasonings (such as more Tabasco or lemon juice) to your preference.

Once mixed, cover the filet américain and let it chill in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

Enjoy your filet américain with some belgian fries and a fresh belgian pint.

See y'all when GTA VI drops.

171819239.review:
Overall, GTA 5 is a really fun game, particularly GTA 5 Online.

Although I'm a bit upset that I lost my saved progress for the story mode, it's OK because GTA 5 Online is still very fun to play and I don't lose my progress there.

I'm not a fan of it throwing me into public lobbies whenever I load up the game, I wish that private lobbies could be turned on my default, so I don't have to load it twice every time.

The other thing I'm not really a fan of is how small the monetary rewards are for everything that isn't a heist and takes ages to save up for anything if you wish to play F2P. If you enjoy heists, then sure it's no problem, but if you're like me and just enjoy playing more casual, then it can be a real struggle at times.

Asides from that, I enjoy the vast variety of different things and freedom you can have and do in this game, it is really nice compared to a lot of other games out there. I am very much looking forwards to GTA 6 being released.

171713823.review: It's been so long since I bought GTA V, got in to the story couple of time, just couldn't bare how story went and characters were boring, online was plagued with cheaters so I ditched it. This summer I got sick and wanted to try GTA Online, and once I found out that I could do solo business, I was instantly hooked and sunk almost 300 hours past 2 months. I gotta say, if you want to play GTA, don't want to do business with cheaters and griefers, story mode is lacking, just play online solo. It's a lot of fun, lot of exploration, things to do, businesses to raise, cars to own, race. Don't be discouraged by griefers, or reviews that say online is full of hackers, just find new invite only session and enjoy. I carry my Steam Deck around just to do daily missions if I'm away form my PC, that's how serious it is :D

170508302.review:
Singleplayer is amazing. The story, characters, map. Even after playing over and over again it's still entertaining. I like it way more than the GTA 4's story.

As for online - this is the reason why I don't recommend the game, because I think that most people nowadays buy the game mainly because of the online. Don't get me wrong; I used to love it, played over 400 hours of pure online, everything was awesome, I thought that this is the perfect multiplayer game, they are constantly updating it and there is a lot of stuff - which has become the problem. A year and a half ago, everything was more or less balanced, the prices were reasonable. After the Import/Export things were getting drastically different. Looked like this to me:

"Hey buddy, want to enjoy the content? Well, you should get our brand new garage only for 2M."

Then Gunrunning. Again, my overall feelings:

"Look at this cool update! The players will be able to get their bunkers only for 1.5M. Also, don't forget to upgrade your equipment for another 1M. Did we forget to mention that getting additional people working for you will only cost you half a million? By the way, you will time from time get raided and lose everything, unless you buy another cameras for 400K! All the raids will magically disappear! Want to modify your weapons in your Workshop? Well, too bad, you need a trailer for that, but don't worry, it's only 1 to 2 and a half millions. Do you want to train your shooting? There you go, only for 700K! Do you prefer white over black? The paint costs 105K, so... Did we mention that you can take a nap there? The key for that room costs 265K. Do you want a Gun Locker which you will probably never use? That will be 175K. You want some caddies? 85K or 120K if you want to have them larger. Don't forget to check out the new cars! Get yourself a car that shoots a couple of missiles only for 4-5M!"

How I felt about Smuggler's Run:

Hello there! This update will be about planes. Want a hangar? 1 to 5M. Which style would you prefer? The one for 100k or the one for 320k? Want different lights? No problem - the more expensive style you chose the more expensive lights you'll get! Isn't that cool? Want some nice 'art' on the floor? Sure, we'll paint it for you, costs only up to 200k, just like your apartment you bought last year to do heists! Furniture? You mean another wall? That's another 280k for you. Again, want the keys to access your bed? 235k-375k. You want to customize your 500k glider? One word - WORKSHOP! And guess what this number, 1,150,000 means... Correct! It's the price!"

The prices of the content added were skyrocketing, if you wanted to truly enjoy the game, you had to either make money all day long if you wanted to be a fair dude that doesn't hack, which is by the way, another big problem with this game, or buy some cards that are horribly overpriced. At this point I didn't have time to play all day long, I didn't want to hack and I totally didn't want to spend twice the price of the game on some cards, so I stopped playing. Since then, I've been ignoring the game, not watching any videos and not paying attention to the updates. Sometimes, when I notice that there's an update, I come back for a couple of minutes and look how a vehicle with a couple of missiles costs over 4 millions. Now another heist update, you might think this:

"Oh, finally another heist, things are getting back to the state when you could buy a house for 200k and get full content."

The reality, however, looks like this:

"Hey, it's nice to see you back in the game, look at this brand new heist room only for 2 millions, the same idea, only way more expensive."

And as a person who doesn't have that much time to play anymore, I can't enjoy the content anymore. Another problem with this game are the hackers. I finally am thrown into a lobby after 10 minutes of loading, I see that I am immediately teleported to an airport from my house with a couple of other people and I am stuck doing some rather strange animations. I always report the guy when I find out who it is, but it doesn't seem to help. I've heard some heartbreaking stories of people getting banned for no reason, this luckily hasn't happened to me yet.

170366691.review:
Grand Theft Auto V (GTA V) is a game that lives up to the hype and delivers an unparalleled experience. Here’s why it’s a must-play:

[b]1. Incredible Graphics:[/b] The game’s visuals are stunning, with highly detailed environments, lifelike character models, and breathtaking cityscapes that make Los Santos feel real.

[b]2. Engaging Storyline:[/b] The narrative is gripping, featuring three distinct protagonists whose intertwining stories provide depth and excitement.

[b]3. Immersive Open World:[/b] The world of Los Santos is vast and full of activities, from heists and street races to random events and hidden treasures.

[b]4. Dynamic Gameplay:[/b] The gameplay is diverse and engaging, offering everything from high-speed chases and shootouts to leisurely exploration and mini-games.

[b]5. Rich Multiplayer Experience:[/b] GTA Online offers a wealth of content, allowing players to engage in cooperative missions, competitive modes, and extensive customization options.

[b]6. Attention to Detail:[/b] Rockstar’s meticulous attention to detail is evident in the realistic physics, intricate animations, and the lively world that reacts to your actions.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]

GTA V is an exceptional game that sets a high bar for open-world adventures. With its incredible graphics, engaging storyline, immersive open world, dynamic gameplay, rich multiplayer experience, and unparalleled attention to detail, it’s a must-play for anyone looking for a thrilling and immersive gaming experience. This game redefines what an open-world game can be and provides endless hours of entertainment.

170612170.review:
**Title: A Disappointing Drive Through Grand Theft Auto 5**

As an avid gamer who appreciates a well-crafted open-world experience, I approached Grand Theft Auto 5 with high hopes. However, my initial enthusiasm quickly turned into profound disappointment as I delved deeper into the game. Here’s why:

**The Good (If Only It Mattered):**
Grand Theft Auto 5 is undeniably a technical marvel. The sprawling city of Los Santos is rendered with breathtaking detail, from its bustling streets to the serene beauty of its countryside. The game offers a vast array of activities, from high-octane heists to leisurely rounds of golf, catering to a wide range of player interests. The storyline, featuring three distinct protagonists, initially promises depth and complexity, weaving their narratives together in a seamless dance of crime and consequence.

**The Bad (Because It Truly Is):**
Despite its technical achievements and breadth of content, Grand Theft Auto 5 ultimately falls short due to a glaring oversight that completely ruins the immersion: the complete absence of ducks. Yes, you read that right—ducks. In a game where realism is supposedly paramount, the developers inexplicably failed to include ducks in any form. Whether it's the urban ponds of Los Santos or the tranquil lakes dotting the countryside, not a single quack can be heard, nor a feather seen drifting idly on the water.

This oversight is not just an aesthetic blunder but a gameplay flaw, as it undermines the ecosystem's integrity within the game world. Players are left wondering why the developers spent countless hours meticulously crafting every other aspect of Los Santos while neglecting such a basic and fundamental element of urban wildlife.

**Conclusion:**
In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto 5 is a prime example of a game that could have been exceptional if not for its inexplicable omission of ducks. While the city of Los Santos may glitter with the promise of adventure and crime, its lack of waterfowl serves as a constant reminder of missed opportunities and unfulfilled potential. Until this oversight is rectified, Grand Theft Auto 5 remains a disappointing reminder of what could have been, leaving players longing for a world where ducks roam freely and quack with reckless abandon.

170586240.review:
GTA V is a heck of a game and I think this is one of those games everyone should have played in his life.
GTA Online is fun with friends, though the bad server infrastructure, modders and the grindy nature can make it really annoying, though I really really enjoyed it for some time.
The Story Mode is where it's at. It gets criticized for all different reasons and I would also criticize a lot about it, but it's still one of my favourite games of all time. It lacks some things the other GTAs have to offer, but makes up for that in other parts where it really excels. Another important part for GTA V is modding. Whether modded Singleplayer (Chaos Mods, just some Enhancements or even a Real Life Simulator) or modded Multiplayer via FiveM or RageMP, GTA V offers something for everyone interested in the overall genre/gameplay and you should not miss out on it!

In short: It's pretty good and worth the price!

171196087.review:
GTA V Online is the biggest disappointment of the whole GTA series: content is tuned for maximum grind (especially the infinite spawning enemies), the missions are made by mostly talentless/bored people and the ingame prices are astronomical. The game is heavily focused on serial killing of NPCs - the "legitimate business" side of the game is nothing more than a chore. Some of the missions genuinely make you ask what are the life goals and self-purpose of the developers. Also the AI, are trained marksmen sniping with shotguns from a few football fields afar.

The singleplayer is meh, and less irritating. Overall the driving and flying experience is underwhelming compared to the previous titles, which questions the reason of this game's existence over GTA III San Andreas.

169870754.review:
GTA 5 isn't just a game; it's a universe. The real gem of this masterpiece isn't found in its epic single-player storyline (though that's legendary in itself), but rather in its online counterpart, GTA Online.

Stepping into GTA Online is like diving headfirst into a living, breathing world where the only limits are your imagination. Want to team up with friends for high-stakes heists? Check. Craving some adrenaline-pumping races through the streets of Los Santos? Got it. How about building a criminal empire from the ground up? You bet.

The sheer variety of activities is mind-blowing. Whether you're cruising through the city in a tricked-out ride, battling rivals in intense PvP matches, or just chilling with your crew in a luxury penthouse, GTA Online ensures there's always something exciting to do.

And let's talk customization. From your character's appearance to your garage full of vehicles and even your own personal nightclub, the level of detail is astonishing. Every choice you make shapes your experience, whether you're climbing the criminal ranks or simply enjoying the nightlife.

Rockstar Games continuously updates GTA Online with new content, keeping the experience fresh and players coming back for more. From new missions and challenges to themed events and seasonal updates, there's always something new to discover.

But what truly sets GTA Online apart is its community. Whether you're making alliances or testing your skills against other players, the social aspect adds a whole new dimension to the game. It's not just about playing; it's about forging connections and creating memories with friends and rivals alike.

In conclusion, GTA 5's online mode isn't just a game; it's a virtual playground where you can live out your wildest criminal fantasies. With its expansive world, endless possibilities, and vibrant community, GTA Online sets the standard for what an online gaming experience should be.

I have played this game since day of release. It has been my favorite game I have ever played. I started playing online within the past year or so. Today I ran into my first issue. A vehicle I purchased was not delivered. This was a horrible first experience and will be my last. Today is the last day I play GTA Online. 169011527.review:
Love the game and the concept, however, the streets are chalk full of cheating players in tanks and rocket launchers. You cannot get more than 20 minutes of game-play before some random cheater starts bombarding you with rockets and tanks, and then they won't stop until you give up and leave, or go invisible and play alone. It's a great concept for a game and it gets updated regularly (weekly), but the developers seemingly have no intention of doing anything about the abundance of cheaters and THIS has taken all the fun out of  the game, at least for me. Also unfortunate, is that they already have your cash before you find out that it is pretty much unplayable due to cheaters.

When I bought the game I bought it because of the "very positive" user reviews, but I honestly have no idea how they merited such positive reviews when it is literally unplayable unless you play solo. I suspect some devious ratings manipulation here and now I cannot trust Steam's Reviews whatsoever.

The launcher will not allow me to play the game due to an older rockstar account being attached to Steam, every time I try to contact support, they either repeatedly copy and paste the same messages or close my support ticket midway through when they feel like they can’t help anymore. 165777895.review: Rockstar and/or Take Two keep finding ways to "fix" the grind in GTA:O while seemingly turning a blind eye to the cheaters and modders. I get it, exploits are bad, especially when they give you the main currency you need for progression. What should be worse in their eyes than money exploits is the fact that my bare IP gets exposed every time I connect to a public server. The fact that merely playing this game can get yourself DOS'd/DDOS'd should be a bigger issue than some glitch I use every now and then to make money because I happen to have a life and the lack of time to truly grind like I used to be able to. To those who somehow haven't purchased this game, either purchase a disc from the ps3/xbox 360 and dump it for emulation, or stick exclusively to single player, consider yourself fortunate to not have exposed yourself to the potential of GTA:O that constantly gets sullied by micro transaction fueled decisions while the PC version somehow gets left behind both in graphics, security, and content.
